title: Textile, 1820
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave
dimensions:
Warp x Weft: 107 x 83 cm (42 1/8 x 32 11/16 in.)
Repeat H: 47.5 cm (18 11/16 in.)
creditline: Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund
description: Length of printed fabric: Scenes of Rome contained within a complex grid based on two overlapped elongated octagons. Monochrome red. Length of repeat 47.5cm (18 3/4"). Lengths of fabric side-by-side would continue repeat. Printed within full width of fabric with uneven margins on left and right.

Textile, 1820.
1820. Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave. Museum purchase from Textile Department Fund. 1980-33-5.
